CatDescriptText: Signs read "Vote the Regular Democratic Ticket, City of Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence; Members of Council: Thomas J. Gallagher, Bennett Rodgers, David Olbum, Patrick T. Fagan, Frederic G. Weir, Irma M. D'Ascenzo; Allegheny County Judge of the Court of Common Pleas: A. Marshall Thompson, Harry M. Montgomery, Homer S. Brown, William F. Cercone, Henry Ellenbogen, John J. Kennedy; Judge of the Orphan's Court: A. L. Wolk, Judge of the County Court: John G. Brosky, Sheriff: William H. Davis, Coroner: Dr. Wm D. McClelland; Clerk of Courts: Thomas E. Barrett; Member of Commission for the Selection of Jurors: Jean Rankin Meanor; County Surveyor: Hiram Milton", "Vote for Patrick J. Corr, Democratic Candidate for Judge...", "Real Republican Candidates for Mayor & City Council, Mayor: John Drew; Council: Kurt J. Lesker 5th on ballot, Tom McCaffrey 6th on ballot, Samuel L. Sherman 9th on ballot, Edward N. Hyde 10th on ballot, Vote Tues. May 21, 1957"Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1957, pg. A3, reads: "Pat Corr's Plan - This advertisement in 16th District of the Fifth Ward polling place (similar to others in the Hill District) was part of Pat Corr's bid to win nomination for Judge of Common Pleas Court Tuesday. Placing this display card beside that of the regular Democratic ticket, indicated his support of all endorsed candidates except the judges.  In spite of this and help from employers of Prothonotary David B. Roberts office, latest unofficial returns show the strategy failed, and Mr. Corr trailed the six incumbent judges. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Brick building with signs for Democratic ticket, including David L. Lawrence for mayor, Patrick Corr for Judge, and Republican party candidates, including John Drew for mayor, and notary public office on right
